p: The coronavirus family recently gained a new member in SARS-CoV-2 to go along with SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV. Infection with SARS-CoV-2 causes COVID-19 which has rapidly become a pandemic (with at the time of writing millions infected and hundreds of thousands dead) requiring social distancing, leading to global shutdowns, resulting in a recession, and pushing healthcare infrastructures to the breaking point. This pandemic is demanding an urgent response and we need to rapidly find treatments which can be accomplished by using existing drugs. Thus, drug repurposing for COVID-19 has garnered mainstream attention which did not occur in previous epidemics ( 1).
